notes: Kumhof, Ranciere, & Winant (2015). Panel FE regressions of public debt accumulation on financial liberalization across 22 OECD countries (1975-2005). Two financial liberalization indexes: Index 1 (Abiad, Detragiache, Tressel 2008) and Index 2 (Chinn-Ito 2008). Main tables: Table O1 (Index 1, 6 columns progressive controls), Table O2 (Index 2, 5 columns). Also Table O3 (interest rate elasticity with interactions). Country FE, robust SE throughout. Paper also includes a Fortran structural model (excluded from spec surface).

design_audit.notes: Stata xtreg, fe vce(robust). Panel of 22 OECD countries, 1975-2005 (31 years). All regressions in first differences of logs (changerealdebt = delta log real debt). Country FE absorb level differences.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Change in log real public debt (changerealdebt = d.log(debtgdp * realgdp))
claim_object.treatment_concept: Financial liberalization, measured by lagged change in GDP-weighted average liberalization index (lag_d_ave_finindex1 for Index 1, d_ave_finindex2 for Index 2)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Within-country association between financial liberalization and public debt growth, controlling for lagged debt level and GDP growth

baseline_specs.label: TableO1-Col6
baseline_specs.notes: Uses Gini coefficient instead of top 1% income share; drops Korea (no Gini data)

constraints.notes: lag_debtgdp and lagchangerealgdp are mandatory (included in all columns). The paper progressively adds EMU dummy, size-finlib interaction, dependency ratio, and inequality measures. changetop1incomeshare and lag_changeave_gini_gross are mutually exclusive (different inequality measures).

canonical.notes: Stata vce(robust) in xtreg fe = HC1 robust SE.

variants.notes: Cluster by country (only 22 clusters, may be unreliable).
Driscoll-Kraay SE for cross-sectional dependence in macro panels.

sampling.notes: 5 optional controls (plus one swap), mandatory 2. Progression from 2 to 6 controls matching the paper's table structure. Random subsets stratified by size.
